docs.snippet: Photographs taken by a New York college student depict a turning point in American history, and will be displayed at the New-York Historical Society next year....

headline.main: Historical Society Exhibition to Commemorate Selma-to-Montgomery March
headline.print_headline: Exhibition Pays Tribute to Selma March

docs.abstract: Photographs taken by a New York college student depict a turning point in American history, and will be displayed at the New-York Historical Society next year.

docs.snippet: Senator Harry Reid, the majority leader who is facing the likely loss of Democratic control of the Senate, is bringing out the bogymen....

headline.main: Worried, Harry Reid Invokes Impeachment Politics

docs.abstract: Senator Harry Reid, the majority leader who is facing the likely loss of Democratic control of the Senate, is bringing out the bogymen.

docs.snippet: The World Health Organization said there had been no increases in laboratory-confirmed cases of Ebola in the country....

headline.main: W.H.O. Sees Ebola Slowing in Liberia

docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization said there had been no increases in laboratory-confirmed cases of Ebola in the country.

docs.snippet: With inaction defining the immigration debate in Washington this year, Latinos’ support for Democrats has softened going into the midterm elections next week, but they still heavily favor Democrats over Republicans, according to a new poll....

headline.main: Latinos Still Lean Toward Democrats, but Less So

docs.abstract: With inaction defining the immigration debate in Washington this year, Latinos’ support for Democrats has softened going into the midterm elections next week, but they still heavily favor Democrats over Republicans, according to a new poll.

docs.snippet: Prosecutors dismissed a felony charge against a western Kentucky man who spent more than a week in jail for posting violent song lyrics to his Facebook page....

headline.main: Ky. Man Who Posted Song Lyrics Won't Face Charges
headline.print_headline: Ky. Man Who Posted Song Lyrics Won't Face Charges

docs.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors dismissed a felony charge against a western Kentucky man who spent more than a week in jail for posting violent song lyrics to his Facebook page.

docs.snippet: Perennial swing state Colorado has been the center of debates about women's health, energy and legalized marijuana. But the closing days of its tight governor's race are coming down to an old-fashioned issue: crime....

headline.main: Last Days of Colorado Governor Race Focus on Crime
headline.print_headline: Last Days of Colorado Governor Race Focus on Crime

docs.lead_paragraph: Perennial swing state Colorado has been the center of debates about women's health, energy and legalized marijuana. But the closing days of its tight governor's race are coming down to an old-fashioned issue: crime.

docs.snippet: A Saudi real estate company has sued Barclays for $10 billion (6.24 billion pounds), claiming the bank ceased pursuing lease payments due from the Saudi government on military complexes in the kingdom in order to obtain a lucrative banking license...

headline.main: Barclays Sued by Saudi Developer for $10 Billion
headline.print_headline: Barclays Sued by Saudi Developer for $10 Billion

docs.lead_paragraph: A Saudi real estate company has sued Barclays for $10 billion (6.24 billion pounds), claiming the bank ceased pursuing lease payments due from the Saudi government on military complexes in the kingdom in order to obtain a lucrative banking license there.

docs.snippet: The European Union and United Nations condemned plans to hold elections in rebel-held areas of eastern Ukraine on Sunday, with the EU explicitly denouncing Moscow's support for the separatists' plans....

headline.main: EU, U.N. Condemn Ukraine Rebels' Election Plans
headline.print_headline: EU, U.N. Condemn Ukraine Rebels' Election Plans

docs.lead_paragraph: The European Union and United Nations condemned plans to hold elections in rebel-held areas of eastern Ukraine on Sunday, with the EU explicitly denouncing Moscow's support for the separatists' plans.

docs.snippet: Houston city attorneys have withdrawn subpoenas that sought speeches and other information from five pastors who publicly opposed an ordinance banning discrimination of gay and transgender residents, the mayor said Wednesday....

headline.main: Court Orders for Texas Pastors' Speeches Withdrawn
headline.print_headline: Court Orders for Texas Pastors' Speeches Withdrawn

docs.lead_paragraph: Houston city attorneys have withdrawn subpoenas that sought speeches and other information from five pastors who publicly opposed an ordinance banning discrimination of gay and transgender residents, the mayor said Wednesday.

docs.snippet: The execution of a Missouri man who killed a woman and her two children is on hold indefinitely as the U.S. Supreme Court decides whether to review the case....

headline.main: Missouri Man's Execution on Hold Indefinitely
headline.print_headline: Missouri Man's Execution on Hold Indefinitely

docs.lead_paragraph: The execution of a Missouri man who killed a woman and her two children is on hold indefinitely as the U.S. Supreme Court decides whether to review the case.
